body_html:
@guillaume-michel how would you use the (converted) cameraImg in the C++ API's run function which accepts a Tensor? In other words, once cameraImg has the image data, how do you get it back to a Tensor?

EDIT: Ah, after looking more closely at the cv::Mat constructor, the cv::Mat and the tensor share the same data in memory.
body_text:
@guillaume-michel how would you use the (converted) cameraImg in the C++ API's run function which accepts a Tensor?  In other words, once cameraImg has the image data, how do you get it back to a Tensor?
EDIT: Ah, after looking more closely at the cv::Mat constructor, the cv::Mat and the tensor share the same data in memory.
body:
@guillaume-michel how would you use the (converted) `cameraImg` in the C++ API's run function which accepts a Tensor?  In other words, once `cameraImg` has the image data, how do you get it back to a Tensor? 

EDIT: Ah, after looking more closely at the `cv::Mat` constructor, the cv::Mat and the tensor share the same data in memory.
